TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationIdentity extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable
Public NotInheritable Class ApplicationIdentity Implements ISerializable

Docs.summary: Provides the ability to uniquely identify a manifest-activated application. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity> class is used in the activation of manifest-based applications.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of an <xref:System.ActivationContext> object to obtain the <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity> for a manifest-based application. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.ActivationContext> class.
[!code-csharp[System.ActivationContext#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ActivationContext/cs/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.ActivationContext#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ActivationContext/vb/program.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string applicationIdentityFullName) cil managed

Docs.param: The full name of the application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The format of the `applicationIdentityFullName` parameter is a comma-delimited Unicode string that begins with the name, as follows:
```
applicationURL # deploymentIdentity \ applicationIdentity
```
Where *deploymentIdentity* =
```
deploymentManifest , Version = Major.Minor.Build.Revision , Culture = CultureInfo , PublicKeyToken= TokenNumber , processorArchitecture= processorArchitecture
```
And *applicationIdentity* =
```
applicationName , Version = Major.Minor.Build.Revision , Culture = CultureInfo , PublicKeyToken= TokenNumber , processorArchitecture= processorArchitecture , type= OsType
```
The following is an example of the full name for an application named ActivationContext:
``` http://testserver/ActivationContext/ActivationContext.application #ActivationContext.application, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ae13aad84c1a3490, processorArchitecture=msil \ActivationContext.exe, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=ae13aad84c1a3490, processorArchitecture=msil, type=win32 ```
The default value for processor architecture is "msil", and the default value for type is "win32".

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CodeBase As String
public: property System::String ^ CodeBase { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the location of the deployment manifest as a URL.
Docs.value: The URL of the deployment manifest.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following are two examples of <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.CodeBase%2A> property values for an application named ActivationContext:
- http://testserver/ActivationContext/ActivationContext.application
- file://C:/UserFiles/UserName/SolutionName/ActivationContext/publish/ActivationContext.application.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of an <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity> object to obtain the value of the <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.CodeBase%2A> property for a manifest-based application. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.ActivationContext> class.
[!code-csharp[System.ActivationContext#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ActivationContext/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.ActivationContext#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.ActivationContext/vb/program.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FullName As String
public: property System::String ^ FullName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the full name of the application.
Docs.value: The full name of the application, also known as the display name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For a description of the format of the <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.FullName%2A> property, see the <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

Docs.summary: Populates a object with the data needed to serialize the target object.
Docs.permission: requires full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted or transparent code.

Docs.summary: Returns the full name of the manifest-activated application.
Docs.returns: The full name of the manifest-activated application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a description of the format of a full name for a manifest activated application, see the <xref:System.ApplicationIdentity.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
